page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: The{B5056}and{B5035}roads provide links to Wirksworth and Ashbourne, although neither road features extensively in the surveyed area. The nearest sizeable village is Brassington and there is a reasonable 4 metre wide tarred road linking up with Bradbourne. Apart from these the roads are narrow and some of those leading to individual farms almost impassable in wet weather. Some of the farms are virtually cut-off during extreme Winter weather. The large number of{footpaths}may be explained by the nearness of the area to the Peak District National Park, and by the area's own attractive landscape. Some of the footpaths surveyed had fallen into disuse due to farmers' intervention.
